api

Interface NeighborGraph<S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IndexedColorGraph<S,C>, IndexedNavigableRootedNeighborGraph<S>, IndexedNeighborGraph<S>, ModifiableColorGraph<S,C>, ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>, NavigableRootedNeighborGraph<S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BreadthFirstNeighborGraphBuilder, IndexedColorGraphBase, IndexedColorGraphBuilder, IndexedNavigableRootedNeighborGraphBase, IndexedNeighborGraphBase, IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder, NeighborGraphBase, NeighborGraphBuilder

    public interface NeighborGraph<S>
    An API for graph data-structures which are both: (i) undirected, and (ii) without multiple edges, on objects of vertex type S. If there is a desired notion of equivalence between objects of the type passed as S, then it is required that the equals and hashcode methods be overridden accordingly in that type. Otherwise, the methods that accept S-parameters will not behave as expected.

    This interface provides methods for querying the following:
       (i) a view of the vertex set of the graph.
       (ii) containment of a given object of type S in the vertex set, and the existence of a link between two given vertices.
      (iii) the sizes of the vertex and edge sets.
      (iv) the collection of neighbors of any given vertex.

    This interface is designed as an API for graph data-structures which do not utilize edge objects explicitly, but rather, keep track of neighbor collections for each vertex.

    To be a legitimate implementation of a undirected graph without multiple edges, the following conditions must be satisfied:
       (i) getNeighborsOf(s) contains no repeated elements.
       (ii) getNeighborsOf(s).contains(t) == getNeighborsOf(t).contains(s)

    Of course, the expression hasEdgeJoining(s, t) == getNeighborsOf(s).contains(t) must always be true. The method hasEdgeJoining is typically implemented precisely in this way, and it is included in the interface solely for convenience.

    Note that despite condition (i) above, the return type of getNeighborsOf(s) is a Collection<S> and not a Set<S>. This allows for implementations to have the flexibility of returning the neighbor set as a List<S> (or perhaps some other type of Collection over <S>), when there is a meaningful ordering on the neighbor set.
    Author:
    pdokos

      boolean containsVertex(S s)
      Returns true if the vertex set of the graph contains the given element of S.
      java.util.Collection<S> getNeighborsOf(S s)
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the collection of neighbors of the given vertex.
      int getNumberOfEdges()
      Returns the number of undirected edges of the graph.
      int getNumberOfVertices()
      Returns the size of the vertex set of the graph.

      Returns an unmodifiable view of the vertex set of the graph.
      boolean hasEdgeJoining(S src, S tgt)
      Returns true if src and tgt are neighbors.
